title: Congress 'welcomes' GST rate cuts but calls decision '8 years too late'
description: Congress has criticized the Centre's recent GST cuts as belated, arguing the original tax design was flawed. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced the rate reductions, effective September 22, shifting many items to the 5% and 18% slabs, with some items now at 0% and others at a 40% 'sin tax' rate.

title: Haider Ali exonerated: Pak cricketer cleared of rape charges in UK
description: Pakistani cricketer Haider Ali has been cleared of rape charges in the UK after a thorough investigation by Greater Manchester Police and the Crown Prosecution Service found insufficient evidence. The case, initiated by a British-Pakistani woman's allegations, was weakened by evidence suggesting a consensual meeting and a delayed complaint.

title: 'US will suffer so greatly': Trump warns of 'unbelievably poor' America

He claimed trade deals with the EU, Japan, and South Korea might be unwound. Experts believe Trump's statements aim to pressure the Supreme Court by highlighting potential economic chaos.

James Webb Telescope: Ghostly dust rings revealed; 'dead' star surprises astronomers
description: The James Webb Space Telescope has captured unprecedented images of the planetary nebula NGC 1514, revealing infrared-bright rings around a dying binary star system. These detailed observations, made with the Mid-Infrared Instrument (MIRI), expose the nebula's complex 4,000-year history and unique thermal dust emission. The findings challenge existing theories about stellar evolution and highlight the intricate interactions within binary systems.

title: Canada rejects 62% of student visas in 2025, toughest stance in a decade
description: Canada’s student visa rejection rate has hit a decade high of 62% in 2025, with Indian applicants facing up to 80% refusals. The clampdown leaves students, families, and universities bearing the brunt of Ottawa’s tighter immigration policies.

The visit was met with protests criticizing gun violence, while Vance met with grieving families inside the church. He pledged to advocate for policies addressing the root causes of such tragedies, emphasizing the need to focus on the lives lost.

title: Haryana’s most wanted gangster Mainpal Badli who opened disco in Cambodia deported
description: Mainpal Badli, Haryana's most wanted gangster, was recaptured after seven years on the run following a parole jump. He had been living in Cambodia as a disco owner under a false identity, having fled India with a fake passport and a large sum of cash.

title: Harvard wins as court reverses Trump’s $2.6B research funding freeze
description: A United States judge has directed the Trump administration to reinstate billions in research funds to Harvard University. The court found the funding cuts were politically motivated. The administration froze the funds, citing concerns about antisemitism. Harvard sued, arguing the move jeopardized vital research. The judge ruled the action violated constitutional rights. The administration plans to appeal.

How Majorana particles promise to shield quantum computers from noise
description: In our everyday world, swapping two identical oranges changes nothing at all. In the quantum world, bosons don’t change their overall wavefunction when swapped whereas fermions change only by a minus sign. If you exchange two non-Abelian anyons, however, the joint quantum state changes in a deeper way with significant implications for quantum computing

title: Nissanka surpasses Dilshan to become SL's third-highest run-getter in T20Is
description: In 66 T20Is for Sri Lanka, Nissanka has scored 1,909 runs at an average of 30.79, with a strike rate of 122.68. He has 15 half-centuries in the format with the best score of 90.

title: From paneer to paratha, Centre explains tweaks in GST rates
description: The GST Council has approved significant rate cuts across various sectors, effective September 22nd, providing relief to consumers and farmers. Daily-use items like hair oil, shampoo, and toothpaste will now attract a reduced 5% GST, while health and life insurance are entirely exempt.

description: Rising Yamuna water levels caused significant traffic disruptions in Delhi, leading to road closures and diversions. Key stretches like Outer Ring Road were affected, with advisories issued for commuters to avoid inundated routes. While the Majnu Ka Tila stretch gradually reopened, congestion persisted on arterial roads, and restrictions may continue depending on the river's water levels.

title: GST revamp: Life & health cover, white goods, most cars to get cheaper
description: The GST Council has approved a major overhaul of the indirect tax system, introducing a simplified two-rate structure of 5% and 18%, along with a 40% slab for select goods. Effective September 22nd, these changes aim to reduce tax burdens on common goods, eliminate classification disputes, and boost consumption.

title: US immigrant students priced out as states end tuition support
description: Thousands of immigrant students across the US are being forced to delay or abandon university as several states revoke access to in-state tuition. The change, driven by shifting immigration policies under President Trump, has led to increased education costs and limited opportunities for students without legal status. Many are turning to online study or entering low-wage work. Legal challenges and federal investigations are also targeting institutions offering tuition support to undocumented students.

Kim Jong's secret lavatory on Beijing trip— Why aides wipe rooms post meetings
description: Kim Jong Un's recent trip to China involved extraordinary measures to safeguard his DNA and health information. He traveled with a private toilet on his armored train, a precaution taken on previous international trips. After his meeting with Vladimir Putin, aides meticulously cleaned the space, removing items and wiping surfaces to eliminate any traces of the leader's DNA.

title: Lunar eclipse 2025: Why is it called a Blood Moon? When & where to watch in India
description: Coffee raves are now a social trend in Indian cities. Cafes are turning into daytime dance floors. This culture is gaining popularity in Mumbai, Bengaluru, and other cities. These events feature electronic music, coffee, and a vibrant community. DJ Tanishq is spearheading this trend with his 'More Coffee More Rave' tour.

title: Happy Teachers Day 2025: 110+ wishes, quotes, images, messages & status to share
description: Teachers' Day in India honors Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, celebrating teachers' vital role in shaping lives. Students express gratitude for their mentors' guidance and dedication. In 2025, individuals can use heartfelt wishes, messages, and quotes to appreciate teachers' profound impact on their academic and personal growth, acknowledging their invaluable contributions.

title: Deion Sanders gives heartfelt fatherhood advice to Jaguars rookie Hunter
description: Deion Sanders offers heartfelt advice to Travis Hunter as he navigates fatherhood and his NFL career with the Jacksonville Jaguars. Their bond, forged at Jackson State and Colorado, transcends football. Sanders' guidance emphasizes correcting past shortcomings in fatherhood, reflecting their deep connection as Hunter embraces his roles as a husband, father, and rising NFL star.

title: Amazon's cost-cutting rule: New phone policy; staff must report personal usage
description: Amazon is now requiring employees to meticulously report the percentage of work-related usage on their company-issued phones. This is to adjust their $50 monthly reimbursements proportionally, based on personal use. This phone monitoring is part of CEO Andy Jassy's "hardcore culture reset" and cost-cutting measures, leading to employee frustration and anxiety about job security.

title: Manju Sharma resigns from RPSC over ‘Rajasthan HC remarks’ on SI exam leak
description: Manju Sharma has resigned from the Rajasthan Public Service Commission (RPSC) following criticism from the Rajasthan High Court regarding the 2021 Sub-Inspector Recruitment Exam. Sharma cited damage to her reputation and the commission's dignity due to the controversy. Her resignation letter has been sent to the governor, and a copy was received by the RPSC.

title: ‘A bet on myself’: Youngest female billionaire on why she left college early
description: Lucy Guo, Forbes' youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her entrepreneurial drive to her frugal upbringing. Despite disappointing her immigrant parents by dropping out of Carnegie Mellon, she pursued the Thiel Fellowship. Guo's early hustles, from playground trading to selling virtual items and creating internet tools, laid the foundation for her success in the tech world.
